analyzed: pa na dang pa na tha snyad de byings 'di rnams las rang don la a'a ya 'gyur te byings byings su byed pa'i rkyen no //

original: sa n'a dyand'a dh'a ta ba: san la @220a * //🔽sogs pa'i mtha' rnams byings so //
analyzed: sa n'a dyand'a dh'a ta ba: san la @220a * // sogs pa'i mtha' rnams byings so //
translated: The final letters of san, ṇ, and ṇ are roots.

original: san la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams sbyar ba'i mtha' dang ka mu la ni sbyar ba'i mtha' yang byings nyid du gnas te byings byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen dang / ming byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen zhes zer ro /
analyzed: san la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams sbyar ba'i mtha' dang ka mu la ni sbyar ba'i mtha' yang byings nyid du gnas te byings byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen dang / ming byings su bsgrub pa'i rkyen zhes zer ro /
translated: The conditions of san and so on are applied. The final letters of ka and mu are also roots. They are called roots that establish roots and conditions that establish nominal roots.

original: ` / gu p'u bsrung ba la a'a ya sbyar a'u yig a'u dati kyi don /
analyzed: ` / gu p'u bsrung ba la a'a ya sbyar a'u yig a'u dati kyi don /

original: puka mtha' au pa dh'a thung ngu dag gi 'os yon tan /
analyzed: puka mtha' au pa dh'a thung ngu dag gi 'os yon tan /

original: byings byings su bsgrubs nas lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar bas cho ga snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: byings byings su bsgrubs nas lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar bas cho ga snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: a'ats'a ma ti sogs dang / nyer bsgyur a'ang sngon na med na ring por mi 'gyur bas /

analyzed: aa takshya t'am /

original: aa takshyan sogs te cho ga thams cad aaksh'u'i skabs su bshad pa dang 'dra'o /
analyzed: aa takshyan sogs te cho ga thams cad aaksh'u'i skabs su bshad pa dang 'dra'o /
translated: All the rules are the same as those explained in the section on akṣu.

original: ` / kri sha rnam par rko ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga yang lung gi skabs ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste /🔽lat la / karsha ti sogs so //
analyzed: ` / kri sha rnam par rko ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga yang lung gi skabs ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste / lat la / karsha ti sogs so //
translated: The rules for applying the affixes lat and so forth to the root kṛṣ, to cut, are the same as the previous ones, except for the case of the scriptures.🔽In lat, there is kṛṣati and so forth.

original: ling la / karshe ta sogs so //🔽lot la / karsha tu sogs so //
analyzed: ling la / karshe ta sogs so // lot la / karsha tu sogs so //
translated: In lin, there is kṛṣet and so forth.🔽In lot, there is kṛṣatu and so forth.

original: lang la / aa karshata sogs so //
analyzed: lang la / aa karshata sogs so //
translated: In lang, there is akṛṣṭa and so forth.

original: lung la cung zad mi 'dra ste /🔽kri sha mrisha @225b spri sha tri pa dri pa sri pashtsle:si dzr'a /
analyzed: lung la cung zad mi 'dra ste / kri sha mrisha @225b spri sha tri pa dri pa sri pashtsle:si dzr'a /
translated: The scriptures are slightly different.🔽kṛṣa mṛṣa spṛṣa trp da trp śrpaśc leḥ si jraḥ

original: kri sha mri sha spri sha tripa dri pa sri pa las tsli'i sitsa yang na'o //
analyzed: kri sha mri sha spri sha tripa dri pa sri pa las tsli'i sitsa yang na'o //
translated: kṛṣa mṛṣa spṛṣa trp da trp śrpa las cliḥ si tsayaṃ naḥ

original: byings kri sha rnam par rko ba /
analyzed: byings kri sha rnam par rko ba /
translated: The root kṛṣ is to cut.

original: mri sha bzod pa /
analyzed: mri sha bzod pa /
translated: Mṛṣa is to endure.🔽Spṛṣa is to touch a vessel and so on.

original: spri sha snod dang reg par byed pa dag la'o dang / tri pa tshim pa /
analyzed: spri sha snod dang reg par byed pa dag la'o dang / tri pa tshim pa /
translated: Trp is to satisfy.

original: dri ba dga' ba /🔽sripli 'gro ba rnams las /
analyzed: dri ba dga' ba / sripli 'gro ba rnams las /
translated: Da is to delight.🔽Śrpa is to go.

original: lung la / tsli'o zhes pas tsli ni sitsar yang na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung la / tsli'o zhes pas tsli ni sitsar yang na 'gyur ro //
translated: In the scriptures, cli is said to be cliḥ si tsayaṃ naḥ.

original: aa nu d'atta sya tsardu pa dha sy'a n+ya ta ra sy'am /
analyzed: aa nu d'atta sya tsardu pa dha sy'a n+ya ta ra sy'am /
translated: The word anudātta, which has the meaning of “not high,” is also used for upapada.

original: aa nu d'a ta'i 'ang rita au pa dh'a'i yang na'o //
analyzed: aa nu d'a ta'i 'ang rita au pa dh'a'i yang na'o //
translated: Anudātta is also used for upapada.

original: aanu d'atta ste byings aatsa skad gsang dma' ba'i 'ang rita au pa dh'a can la dzhal so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge ka 'gro ba'i ming can ma yin pa pha rol la aam a'a ga ma yang na 'jug ste /
analyzed: aanu d'atta ste byings aatsa skad gsang dma' ba'i 'ang rita au pa dh'a can la dzhal so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge ka 'gro ba'i ming can ma yin pa pha rol la aam a'a ga ma yang na 'jug ste /
translated: Anudātta, which has the meaning of “not high,” is a word that has the suffix ṭa and is not a letter that is collected separately from jha. It is used for the word of another person, “am,” “āgamya,” or “api.”

original: tsli si tsar bsgyur ba'i phyogs kyi aam ma byin pa'i skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽aa k'arkshita/...(bad bra dza ha la mtha' sogs kyis 'phel ba sa la sha dha dag gis zhes pas sha ka / kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sasha /
analyzed: tsli si tsar bsgyur ba'i phyogs kyi aam ma byin pa'i skyes bu dang po gsum la / aa k'arkshita/...(bad bra dza ha la mtha' sogs kyis 'phel ba sa la sha dha dag gis zhes pas sha ka / kun nas bsgyur ba sogs kyis sasha /
translated: In the case of changing c to j, the three first persons of the aorist are:🔽akārṣīt, akārṣṭa, akārṣṭa.🔽The word akārṣīt is used for the aorist.🔽The word akārṣṭa is used for the present.

original: ka sha 'dus paksha a'it la drangs/) aa k'arsht'am/.. ..(latas /🔽tas thas sogs kyis t'am du bsgyur /🔽dzhala las dzhal la 'os /🔽sitsa 'jig /sha tu lashtu 'os t'am t'am drangs/) aa k'arshu:/
analyzed: ka sha 'dus paksha a'it la drangs/) aa k'arsht'am/.. ..(latas /🔽tas thas sogs kyis t'am du bsgyur /🔽dzhala las dzhal la 'os /🔽sitsa 'jig /sha tu lashtu 'os t'am t'am drangs/) aa k'arshu:/
translated: The word akārṣṭa is used for the imperative.

original: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
translated: For the three middle persons,

original: aa k'arksh'i:/ aa k'arshtmam /
analyzed: aa k'arksh'i:/ aa k'arshtmam /
translated: akarshi, akarshatam,

original: aa k'arshta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: aa k'arshta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: akarshat. For the three last persons,🔽akarsham, akarshav,

original: aa k'arksham / aa k'arkshva /🔽aa k'arkshma / aama sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: aa k'arksham / aa k'arkshva / aa k'arkshma / aama sbyar ba'i phyogs la /
translated: akarsham.

original: mra gnas don dang aika gi aatsa la yan byas pas /
analyzed: mra gnas don dang aika gi aatsa la yan byas pas /
translated: In the case of the addition of am, the meaning of the locative case and the affix iṭ are made.

original: skyes bu dang po gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu dang po gsum la /
translated: For the first three persons,

original: aa kr'aksh'i ta /
analyzed: aa kr'aksh'i ta /
translated: akarshit,

original: aa kr'asht'am / aa kr'a kshu:/
analyzed: aa kr'asht'am / aa kr'a kshu:/
translated: akarshatam, akarshuḥ.

original: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /
translated: For the three middle persons,

original: aa kr'aksh'i:/ aa kr'ashta /
analyzed: aa kr'aksh'i:/ aa kr'ashta /
translated: akarshi, akarshat,

original: aa kr'ashta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /🔽aa kr'a ksham /
analyzed: aa kr'ashta / skyes bu phyi ma gsum la / aa kr'a ksham /
translated: akarshat. For the three last persons,🔽akarsham,

original: aa kr'akshva / aa kr'akshma /🔽sha la ai gu pa dh'a da ni taksa:/🔽sha la aika au pa dh'a ait med pa las ksa'o //
analyzed: aa kr'akshva / aa kr'akshma / sha la ai gu pa dh'a da ni taksa:/ sha la aika au pa dh'a ait med pa las ksa'o //
translated: akarshav, akarsham.🔽In the case of the addition of iṭ,🔽iṭ is added to śalya, which has a final vowel, and the affix ksa is added.

original: byings shal so sor (bad bradza sogs kyis ring po/) bsdu ba'i yi ge'i mtha' can au pa dh'a na aika so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yod pa ait med pa las tsli niksa zhes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byings shal so sor (bad bradza sogs kyis ring po/) bsdu ba'i yi ge'i mtha' can au pa dh'a na aika so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yod pa ait med pa las tsli niksa zhes par 'gyur te /
translated: The root śalya has a final vowel, and iṭ is added to upaghāta, which has a final vowel. The affix ksa is added to iṭ, which does not have a final vowel. This becomes iṭanika.

original: kra yig ni ka 'gro ba la aama mi ster ba'i don yin pas dbyi'o //
analyzed: kra yig ni ka 'gro ba la aama mi ster ba'i don yin pas dbyi'o //
translated: The letter kra means “to go” and “to give” (gam and dam), and so it is the anusvara.

original: krisha la lung /
analyzed: krisha la lung /
translated: The letter kra means “to give” (dā) and “to go” (gam), and thus it means “to give up” (tyaj).

original: lung la tsli 'os /
analyzed: lung la tsli 'os /
translated: [The letter] kṣa is “to go” (gam).🔽“To go” is “to give” (dā).

original: tsli byin / mdo 'dis tsli ka sa ru bsgyur /
analyzed: tsli byin / mdo 'dis tsli ka sa ru bsgyur /
translated: This sūtra translates “to give” as “to go.”

original: ka phyis pas skyes bu dang po gsum la /🔽aa kri kshata /🔽aa kri ksha t'am /
analyzed: ka phyis pas skyes bu dang po gsum la / aa kri kshata / aa kri ksha t'am /

analyzed: aa kri kshana /
translated: or akṛkṣaṇ

original: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la /🔽aa krai ksha:/ aa kri ksha tam /
analyzed: skyes bu dbus ma gsum la / aa krai ksha:/ aa kri ksha tam /
translated: is for the three middle men.🔽[The word] akṛkṣaḥ🔽or akṛkṣātam

original: aa kri kshata /
analyzed: aa kri kshata /
translated: or akṛkṣaṭ

original: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
analyzed: skyes bu phyi ma gsum la /
translated: is for the three last men.

original: aa kri ksham /🔽aa kri ksh'a ba /
analyzed: aa kri ksham / aa kri ksh'a ba /
translated: [The word] akṛkṣam🔽or akṛkṣāva

analyzed: aa kriksh'a ma / krisha la lit sbyar ba'i skyes bu dang po @226a * //

analyzed: ` / ru sha 'tsho ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la /

original: lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar pa'i cho ga rnams kyang luta'i skabs ma gtogs snga ma rnams kyis rigs 'gre ste /🔽lat la / ro sha ti sogs so //

original: ` / ri sha 'tshe ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la'ang lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga thams cad bshad ma thag pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ` / ri sha 'tshe ba la'o zhes pa'i byings la'ang lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga thams cad bshad ma thag pa dang 'dra ste /

original: 'on kyang lut la ait yang na bar byed la /
analyzed: 'on kyang lut la ait yang na bar byed la /

analyzed: gzhan bal dang po rnams la ait rtag tu sbyor te / lat la / re sha ti sogs so // ling la / re shet sogs so //

analyzed: lot la / re sha tu sogs so // lang la / aa re shat sogs so //

analyzed: lung la / aa re sh'it / aa re shisht'am /

analyzed: ri ri sha tu:/

original: resht'a sogs so //
analyzed: resht'a sogs so //

original: smon pa'i ling la /
analyzed: smon pa'i ling la /

analyzed: ri shy'at sogs so // lrit la / re shi shya ti sogs so //

analyzed: lring la / aa re shi shyat sogs so / ` / au sha sreg pa la'o zhes pa'i byings la /

analyzed: lat sogs pa rasmee pa da rnams sbyar ba'i cho ga rnams kyang lita'i skabs ma gtogs snga ma rnams dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: tsang gi nga yig nga 'gro ba'i don dang tsa yig tsang la'o zhes byings gnyis brjod pa'i don /

analyzed: aa da dhan /

original: lung la / pusha la sogs pa rnams dang dyu ta la sogs pa rnams dang li 'gro ba sogs kyis tsli aang du bsgyur ba dang / kri sha mri sha tri pa dri pa srib sogs kyis yang na tsli si tsar bsgyur bas si tsa ru bsgyur ba'i phyogs la /
analyzed: lung la / pusha la sogs pa rnams dang dyu ta la sogs pa rnams dang li 'gro ba sogs kyis tsli aang du bsgyur ba dang / kri sha mri sha tri pa dri pa srib sogs kyis yang na tsli si tsar bsgyur bas si tsa ru bsgyur ba'i phyogs la /
translated: and the method of changing the final -a of the Sanskrit words such as kṛṣṇa, miśra, trīpa, trīpa, and prīti into -i,🔽and then changing the -i into -u.🔽In the case of the first method, there are three:🔽the method of changing the final -a of the Sanskrit words such as puṣpa into -i,🔽the method of changing the final -a of the Sanskrit words such as dyūta into -i,🔽and the method of changing the final -a of the Sanskrit words such as gati into -i.🔽In the case of the second method, there are three:

original: aa nu d'atta'i'ang rita au pa dh'a sogs kyis aam a'a ga ma yang na 'jug pas bsgrub tshul gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: aa nu d'atta'i'ang rita au pa dh'a sogs kyis aam a'a ga ma yang na 'jug pas bsgrub tshul gsum 'byung ste /

original: aa sri pa t'am /🔽aa sri pan sogs so //

translated: and then changing the -i into -u,🔽and the method of changing the final -a of the Sanskrit words such as kṛṣṇa, miśra, trīpa, trīpa, and prīti into -i,

original: tsli si tsar bsgyur nas aam a'a ga ma byin pa'i phyogs la /🔽aa sra ps'ita /
analyzed: tsli si tsar bsgyur nas aam a'a ga ma byin pa'i phyogs la / aa sra ps'ita /

translated: and then changing the -i into -u,🔽the method of changing the final -a of the Sanskrit words such as kṛṣṇa, miśra
